trans-unit.source: This topic provides the JSON format that is supported by the July 2015 Release of AzurePowerShell.
trans-unit.target: This topic provides the JSON format that is supported by the July 2015 Release of AzurePowerShell.

trans-unit.source: If you are using an older version, see <link xlink:href="8e3cee3a-7757-4824-857e-17ed7c1bf27d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure SQL Linked Service</link> for the old JSON format.
trans-unit.target: If you are using an older version, see <link xlink:href="8e3cee3a-7757-4824-857e-17ed7c1bf27d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure SQL Linked Service</link> for the old JSON format.

trans-unit.source: You create an Azure SQL linked service to link an Azure SQL database to an Azure data factory.
trans-unit.target: You create an Azure SQL linked service to link an Azure SQL database to an Azure data factory.

trans-unit.source: This topic describes syntax for defining an Azure SQL linked service in a JSON file.When you use the Data Factory Editor in Azure Portal, the editor provides you a JSON template for defining a linked service that you can modify and deploy to create a linked service.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes syntax for defining an Azure SQL linked service in a JSON file.When you use the Data Factory Editor in Azure Portal, the editor provides you a JSON template for defining a linked service that you can modify and deploy to create a linked service.

trans-unit.source: To use the <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.Azure.Commands.DataFactories.New-AzureDataFactoryLinkedService</codeEntityReference> cmdlet to create a linked service, you will need to create a JSON file and use it with the cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: To use the <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.Azure.Commands.DataFactories.New-AzureDataFactoryLinkedService</codeEntityReference> cmdlet to create a linked service, you will need to create a JSON file and use it with the cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: If you want to copy data to an Azure SQL database, ensure that the IP address of the gateway machine falls in the range specified in the database-level rule for the database.
trans-unit.target: If you want to copy data to an Azure SQL database, ensure that the IP address of the gateway machine falls in the range specified in the database-level rule for the database.

trans-unit.source: See <externalLink><linkText>Azure SQL Database Firewall</linkText><linkUri>https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/ee621782.aspx</linkUri></externalLink> for details about the Azure SQL Database Firewall.
trans-unit.target: See <externalLink><linkText>Azure SQL Database Firewall</linkText><linkUri>https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/ee621782.aspx</linkUri></externalLink> for details about the Azure SQL Database Firewall.

trans-unit.source: For an on-premises SQL Server database, ensure that the firewall on your network/computer hosting the Data Management Gateway allows outgoing communication on TCP port 1433.
trans-unit.target: For an on-premises SQL Server database, ensure that the firewall on your network/computer hosting the Data Management Gateway allows outgoing communication on TCP port 1433.

trans-unit.source: The type property should be set to: <embeddedLabel>AzureSqlDatabase</embeddedLabel>
trans-unit.target: The type property should be set to: <embeddedLabel>AzureSqlDatabase</embeddedLabel>

trans-unit.source: Specify information needed to connect to the Azure SQL Database instance for the connectionString property.
trans-unit.target: Specify information needed to connect to the Azure SQL Database instance for the connectionString property.
